title: How to create own training set?
body: When starting training, I can only select the example training set. Howcan I define my own training set? E.g. how can I select the desired muscle groups to target and exercises?

title: Download exercises - statusbar
body:
Actually, i'm not sure if there is something downloading i let it now run for about 30 minutens and its still not finished.
Maybe let it fetch online how much is available and then drop a 14/60 kind of statusbar.

But the author wrote already that he does not intend to maintain it anymore.

title: How do I see the data of my exercises?
body:
App shows no menu entry to view past exercises.  This seems very weird.  Why am I asked to input weights and durations when my data is not going to be useful later?

Versoin 0.7.5 F-Droid.

title: Customize the recovery phase time?
body:
Is there a way to change the 30sec time?
Many thanks

title: Are submodules used (as suggested by README)?
body: The readme tells to `git submodule init` and `git submodule update`, but I cannot find any references to submodules.

title: Which gradle vesion should be used?
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body: The gradle file says `task wrapper (type: Wrapper) { gradleVersion = "1.11" }`, but plug-in requires 2.2.1.

title: Broken conversion from SVG to PNG
body: `https://github.com/chaosbastler/opentraining/blob/master/app/svg/exercises/xport-width%3D1200` is actually PNG file, but the file name suggest it was actually meant as an commandline option. Could you check this?

title: Refactoring of OpenTraining for course
body:
[Changelog.pdf](https://github.com/chaosbastler/opentraining/files/49409/Changelog.pdf)
This refactoring was done in the scope of a design pattern course at Concordia University.

title: Updated to Display Images for Those that have them, and otherwise displa...

title: Exercise Title - Case
body: Case on "axe hold" does not match the case standard presented by the others. (for example "Arnold Shoulder Press" and "Bear Walk"). There are a few others with capitalization defects. ("Barbell shrugs instead of "Barbell Shrugs").

Hello, Christian
I translated exercise data in assets folder.

title: Support super set Training

Some ideas:

1: When you create a plan, select which exercises belong together to a super set

2: When you train a super set and finished ex. no 1, directly open the next exercise of the super set

title: Display description if there's no image

body: The app should display the description of the exercise when there is no image but an description.

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: The app does not create an icon for a custom exercise

title: Documentation
body:
Documentation should be maintained for both the End Users and the Developers. Github provides a basic wiki system which should be sufficient for now. Depending on the growth of the application, there may need to be consideration given to move on to something a bit more flexible. 

The benefits of documenting in a single location (i.e. the wiki)
- Accessibility to Up To Date relevant information
- Source Controlled. Can roll back if necessary
- Can be linked from within the application for End User Help functionality
- Can be Used as an easy means to keep valid references to Licenses
- Perfect for Development Environment Setup Information
- Good For General Development Documentation (i.e. details on bug-fixes)

Considerations for documentation
- How To Articles (For Developers and End Users)
- Exercises
- Settings
- Revision History (changelog - Just needs copied from already existing source)

title: NullPointerException in SelectWorkoutDialogFragment
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="cantfix")]
body:
Reported via Google Developer Console (Stack-Trace below).

The NullPointerException occurs at:

``` java
Intent intent = new Intent(getActivity(), FExListActivity.class);
```

It seems like `getActivity()` returns null. Unfortunately I could not reproduce this bug and I don't know why it occurs or how to fix it. So issue-status will be set to cantfix.

title: Increased weight limit (from 200 kg to 500 kg). Fixes issue #21
body:
Also changed implementation of exercise/image download from wger: if a downloaded exercise refers to an image that already exists, the exercise is considered to be duplicate.
Its download will be skipped.

title: Simplify exercise import by filtering via API
body: Remove some client-side logic, most of the API fields now allow filtering.

title: Add (better) descriptions
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Currently there are not many descriptions.

There should be:
- a list of instructions: how to do the exercise (1. ... 2. ...)
- a list of things to consider (e.g. 'do not bow your arm')
- general information about the exercise (including information about muscles)

title: High resolution exercise images
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Add high resolution exercise images for high resolution devices(like Nexus 5)

title: Increase weight limit
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="fixed")]
body: A user requested to be able to set weights up to 400 kg (e.g. for leg press).

title: Fix typo
body: Fix typo on exercise description

title: Keep scroll state
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="fixed")]
body: When a new workout is created, the exercise list does not save the scroll state (which exercises are visible?). When returning to the exercise list the list is always reset. Same happens when orientation changes.

title: Highlight selected exercises
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="fixed")]
body: When the user creates a new workout, the selected exercises should be highlighted/marked.

title: Add Timer
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="fixed")]
body:
When a set is finished, the timer should signal the user when to continue with the next set. When an exercise is finished, the timer should signal the user when to continue with the next exercise.

The user should be able to set both periods and it should be possible to disable this feature.

title: downgrade to android-sdk-21
body: dependency hell with android-maven-plugin

title: Backup
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body: Implement cloud backup: http://developer.android.com/training/cloudsync/backupapi.html

title: Add project to a localization site
body: http://crowdin.net/page/android-localization

title: add travis ci
body:
1. visit http://about.travis-ci.org/docs/user/getting-started/
2. follow the instruction
3. ???
4. profit

title: Custom exercises
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="fixed")]
body:
The user should be able to create custom exercises.

It should be possible to add self-made photos, e.g. a photo of a book that describes the exercise.

title: Reporting errors
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
User should be able to report errors concerning the exercises.

There should be an easy way to report wrong names, wrong equipment, wrong muscles or missing images.

title: Exercise are not translated
label: [Label(name="fixed")]
body: Currently exercises cannot be translated. At least english should be supported.

title: Little images/icons on the plan
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="invalid")]
body:
There should be little images representing the exercises on the exported plan.

Reason: the name alone might be not enough to remember the exercise.

title: Use the plan without printing
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently the plan cannot be used without printing. Once exported you can't change anything anymore.

In future, the user should be able to enter his training data while using the app.

title: Crash on small screens
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
On a smaller screen(-> no tablet) the app crashes after selecting an exercise.
This is probably a problem concerning handling fragments.

I tried to fix this bug for hours - but I could not fix it :-(
Smaller screens cannot be supported as long as this bug is not fixed.

title: Crash when downloading without internet connection
label: [Label(name="fixed")]
body: App crashes when you try to download exercises without an internet connection

title: App crash when unselecting all muscles
label: [Label(name="fixed")]
body: The action 'unselect all muscles'(in activity "SelectExercisesActivity" ) causes the application to crash.
